name: the-architect_basic
description: Basic architect agent with standard session and agent IDs

tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: dev-arch-session-001 AgentId: arch-001

Design a scalable microservices architecture for an e-commerce platform that can handle 50,000 concurrent users, support multiple payment gateways, and provide real-time inventory management across multiple warehouses.

name: the-developer_with_code
description: Developer agent with code implementation task

tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: dev-dev-session-002 AgentId: dev-002

Implement a secure user authentication system using JWT tokens with the following requirements:

1. Email/password login
2. Password strength validation
3. Rate limiting for login attempts
4. JWT token refresh mechanism
5. Role-based access control

Use Go with the gin framework and implement proper error handling.

name: the-tester_comprehensive
description: Tester agent with comprehensive testing strategy

tool_input.description: Create comprehensive test suite for API endpoints
tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: dev-test-session-003 AgentId: test-003

Create a comprehensive test suite for the user authentication API endpoints including:

- Unit tests for all authentication functions
- Integration tests for API endpoints
- End-to-end tests for user workflows
- Performance tests for concurrent login scenarios
- Security tests for common attack vectors

Ensure >90% code coverage and include both positive and negative test cases.

name: the-reviewer_security_focused
description: Reviewer agent focused on security review

tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: dev-review-session-004 AgentId: review-004

Conduct a comprehensive security code review of the authentication module focusing on:

1. SQL injection vulnerabilities
2. Cross-site scripting (XSS) prevention
3. CSRF protection implementation
4. Password hashing and storage security
5. JWT token security best practices
6. Input validation and sanitization
7. Error handling that doesn't leak sensitive information

Provide specific recommendations for any issues found.

tool_input.description: Optimize database queries and API performance
tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: dev-opt-session-005 AgentId: opt-005

Optimize the application performance with focus on:

1. Database query optimization (identify N+1 queries)
2. API response time improvements
3. Memory usage optimization
4. Caching strategy implementation
5. Connection pooling optimization
6. Query result pagination
7. Background job processing efficiency

Target: <200ms API response time for 95% of requests under 1000 concurrent users.

name: special_characters
description: Agent with special characters and escape sequences

tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: dev-special-session-007 AgentId: special-007

Implement robust string processing that handles:

1. Quoted strings: "double quotes", 'single quotes'
2. Escape sequences: \n newlines, \t tabs, \r carriage returns
3. Backslashes: \path\to\file, C:\\Users\\Name
4. JSON special chars: {"key": "value", "array": [1, 2, 3]}
5. SQL injection attempts: '; DROP TABLE users; --
6. XSS attempts: <script>alert('xss')</script>
7. Control characters: \u0000 - \u001F
8. High ASCII: Â½ Â± Ã· Ã— Â° Â²

Ensure proper sanitization and encoding.

name: long_prompt
description: Agent with very long prompt to test large content handling

tool_input.description: Process large document with detailed requirements
tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: dev-long-session-008 AgentId: long-008

Implement a comprehensive document management system with the following detailed requirements:

1. Feature requirement with detailed specification that includes multiple sub-requirements, implementation notes, security considerations, performance targets, testing requirements, documentation needs, and maintenance procedures. 1. Feature requirement with detailed specification that includes multiple sub-requirements, implementation notes, security considerations, performance targets, testing requirements, documentation needs, and maintenance procedures. 1. Feature requirement with detailed specification that includes multiple sub-requirements, implementation notes, security considerations, performance targets, testing requirements, documentation needs, and maintenance procedures. 1. Feature requirement with detailed specification that includes multiple sub-requirements, implementation notes, security considerations, performance targets, testing requirements, documentation needs, and maintenance procedures. 1. Feature requirement with detailed specification that includes multiple sub-requirements, implementation notes, security considerations, performance targets, testing requirements, documentation needs, and maintenance procedures. 

This system must handle enterprise-scale document processing with high availability, scalability, and security requirements.

name: missing_session_id
description: Agent without SessionId in prompt (should fallback to session discovery)

tool_input.prompt:
AgentId: fallback-009

Handle the scenario where session ID is not provided in the prompt and must be discovered through other means. This tests the fallback mechanism for session identification.

name: missing_agent_id
description: Agent without AgentId in prompt (should handle gracefully)

tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: dev-no-agent-session-010

Handle the scenario where agent ID is not provided in the prompt. The system should gracefully handle this case and still log the event appropriately.

name: alternative_session_format
description: Agent with alternative SessionId format (without colon)

tool_input.prompt:
SessionId alt-format-011 AgentId: alt-011

Test handling of alternative session ID formats that might not include colons or have different spacing patterns.

name: multiple_session_ids
description: Agent with multiple session IDs in prompt (should use first one)

tool_input.description: Test multiple session IDs in prompt
tool_input.prompt:
SessionId: first-session-012 AgentId: multi-012

This prompt contains multiple session references: SessionId: second-session-012 and SessionId: third-session-012. The system should handle this appropriately.
